Employee: Current  Employee  in Saint Louis, Missouri
Description: [' 50 percent off food.']

Employee: Former  Hostess  in Charlotte, North Carolina
Description: [' health insurance, 50% off food, 401k, dental and vision, and thats about all i can think of right. the typical things offered at a restaurant,']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Culver City, California
Description: [" Need to work at least 35 hours, and most hourly do not, so don't get the good benefit package. Most are eligible for hospital only benefits or low benefit package, so better just to get your own health insurance to be covered."]

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Raleigh, North Carolina
Description: [' There definitley are benefits available, but you have to work at least 30 hours a week to be able to enroll in them and most employees are scheduled less than 30 hours a week.']

Employee: Former  Kitchen Manager  in Queens Village, New York State
Description: [' Best is Atnea health and worst is vacation policy. You can only go away when they eant you too.']

Employee: Current  Server/Waiter  in Long Beach, California
Description: [' Health benefits could be a little more accessible.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [' They are not very clear as to what works for each individual person. The packages are also really expensive.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in San Francisco, California
Description: [' For an hourly position this company has good benefits']

Employee: Former  Server/Waitress  in Brookhaven, Georgia
Description: [' I never received benefits but I do think they were provided after a certain length of time or hours. There was free food to take home everyday of your training and they were usually alright giving away screw ups so free food is a perk. You receive an employee discount.']

Employee: Former  Community Brand Ambassador  in Raleigh, North Carolina
Description: [' Optional health benefits, I believe there is dental and health insurance. No paid time off since I was working an hourly position.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Los Angeles, California
Description: [" The benefits package at CPK is pretty comprehensive. Medical is pretty expensive but I think that's the case pretty much everywhere."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Kansas City, Missouri
Description: [' They did not really offer us any sort of benefits package for health insurance or 401K. As a Server/Bartender/Host this was nothing that you could receive.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Orem, Utah
Description: [' You need to consistently work 40 hours for an extended period of time to be eligible for perks and most employees are part-time employees.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Durham, North Carolina
Description: [' No true benefits offered at this job.']

Employee: Current  Host  in Las Vegas, Nevada
Description: [' Best thing is insurance & tips earnings']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Kansas City, Missouri
Description: [' There really are not any benefit packages for this company. I believe if you are in management they will offer your Health insurance options and perhaps a 401K option. But, as a server there really was not anything at the time of my employment that they provided. You could opt in for an insurance plan, but anyone who has been a server knows that a servers minimum wage is so minimal that you barely ever receive a real paycheck.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Irvine, California
Description: [" Best was 50% off employee meal... which use to be $1 after 3 years... but the new owner changed that. Also we use to be able to wear black pants, and now we have to wear jeans. As the minimum wage rises to accommodate for price increase, so does CPK's items, which is ridiculous and defeats the purpose of raised the minimum wage."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Huntington Beach, California
Description: [' Decent benefits package, however only available to employee who work full-time. Part-time employees have no benefits. Must enroll online.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Alpharetta, Georgia
Description: [' No perks. I was surprised to find that there were no perks associated with this job. This is the case with most server jobs anyways']

Employee: Former  Server  in Skokie, Illinois
Description: [' N/A. Little time off... but can be requested 2 weeks in advance.']

Employee: Current  Busser/FoodRunner  in Irvine, California
Description: [" I get to eat and enjoy all the different pizza's. Surrounded by a young community and love who I work with!"]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Denver, Colorado
Description: [" Best are my coworkers. Worst is the pay. Bartenders don't make nearly enough"]

Employee: Former  Food Server  in Sacramento, California
Description: [' I got insurance and 401K access. Cannot beat that as a server.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Arlington Heights, Illinois
Description: [' Half off discount was the best part']

Employee: Former  GM  in Los Angeles, California
Description: [' Decent health insurance. Not a competitive vacation package.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Bellevue, Washington State
Description: [' Managers allowed flexible schedules to accommodate schooling']

Employee: Current  Server/Waiter  in Troy, Michigan
Description: [' You cannot receive benefits unless you work full-time. However, there are too many employees working to get enough shifts to be eligible for benefits.']

Employee: Former  Host/Hostess  in Santa Monica, California
Description: [' requesting time off is extremely difficult.']

Employee: Current  Server Trainer  in Honolulu, Hawaii
Description: [' they offer health insurance in Hawaii if you work a minimum of 20 hours mainland stores it\'s a minimum of 30. offer 401k but does not match. offered a yearly "bonus" check on your anniversary date IF you make the required hours']

Employee: Current  Server  in Nashville, Tennessee
Description: [" The best thing about the restaurant is the staff who you work with. The worst, is the company rewards program that isn't worth anything but getting customers to sign up still a mandatory aspect of the job."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in San Diego, California
Description: [" I don't get the benefits package because I am a part time employee"]

Employee: Former  host, takeout server  in Westwood, California
Description: [' I was working part time so I did not get any benefits from CPK.']

Employee: Former  Server/Hostess  in Irvine, California
Description: [" I wasn't a salaried employee, so I didn't get benefits. I was able to get vacation time off, but not paid."]

Employee: Former  Server  in Lakewood, Colorado
Description: [' The best thing about working here was the flexibility in the schedule. The worst was being dependent on tips.']

Employee: Former  Hostess  in Palo Alto, California
Description: [" As a part time employee I didn't get any benefits except I think medical was listed, but I had my Father's insurance at the time. Can't talk about any benefits really."]

Employee: Former  Server  in Los Angeles, California
Description: [" Obviously full-time employees receive almost all of the benefits listed below, but as a part-time employee you don't receive even half of that. But that being said for a restaurant job as a part-time employee you have access to so many benefits that many other places do not offer."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Fresno, California
Description: [' You can switch on hot schedules your shifts with manager approval']

Employee: Current  General Manager  in Birmingham, Alabama
Description: [' Overall the benefits are good. The health insurance I feel is more expensive than what I am used to, and also not as good.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Bellevue, Washington State
Description: [' Time is flexible on your vacation days. Worst thing is that they do not allow overtime work.']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Waikïkï, Hawaii
Description: [" The environment is very legalistic; granted, it is corporate. It operates like a manufacturing line... If you honestly enjoy being a cook for your occupation, I'd recommend somewhere less bottom-line driven -- somewhere that management actually appreciates food."]

Employee: Current  General Manager  in Raleigh, North Carolina
Description: [' Great benefits. Standard, but have been very helpful during my career.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Boulder, Colorado
Description: [' It takes a while to be eligible to receive a benefits package that is actually worth using. If you work 40 hours per week, you are eligible for the worthwhile package after 6 months I believe?']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Hartford, Connecticut
Description: [' In relation to other serving jobs the benefits are average, but compared to a non-serving job they are below average.']

Employee: Current  agm  in Warrenville, Illinois
Description: [' Many options and coverage.. .but costly']

Employee: Current  Manager  in Los Angeles, California
Description: [" They offer a fairly generous vacation benefit to managers but don't let you take it, then tell you you have too many hours of vacation available so you can't accrue any more which means you lose that time. The insurance package has changed 3 times in 5 years, each time for the worse. The work from home program is in addition to your regular 60 hour week, not part of it. The bonus program has changed so many times in the last 5 years that I don't even try to calculate it anymore. We do get a generous discount program but most of us never use it because if we came in with friends or family we would spend the entire meal dealing with employee issues and honestly, I see the food all week, why would I come in and eat it on my very precious time off?"]
